headline.main: ASKS BIDS TO RETIRE BONDS; New York Telephone Co. Has $750,000 Available--Uruguay Cuts Loan.
FOREIGN TRADE GAINS $7,864,440 IN URUGUAY; Increase of $10,996,604 Over 1929 in Exports, Chiefly of Meat and Farm Products, Responsible.

docs.snippet: RIVERA, Uruguay, Oct. 6.--The object of the Brazilian revolution is to prevent the inauguration of President-elect Julio Prestes, to overthrow President Washington Luiz and the entire Federal Government, to establish a Provisional Government,...

docs.abstract: F F da Cunha outlines reasons for revolt

headline.main: LEADER GIVES PLANS IN BRAZILIAN REVOLT; Colonel da Cunha Says Object Is to End Abuses of the Federal Government. WOULD HOLD NEW ELECTION Prestes Was Elected by Fraud, He Charges--Scores Waste by Washington Luiz.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: RIO GRANDE DO SUL QUIET.; Business Goes On as Usual In Brazilian State Despite Revolt.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Oct. 8.--The consensus of today's reports indicates that the Federals are now well organized and ready to carry out their military program of reducing the revolutionary forces in the States of Minas Geraes and Rio Grande do Sul.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Oct. 8.--The consensus of today's reports indicates that the Federals are now well organized and ready to carry out their military program of reducing the revolutionary forces in the States of Minas Geraes and Rio Grande do Sul.
docs.abstract: Pernambuco falls to rebels; Govt gains in Minas Geraes; rebels claim wide gains

headline.main: PERNAMBUCO FALLS TO BRAZILIAN REBELS; 150 DIE IN BATTLE; Crucial Fight Imminent as Insurgents Advance on City of Sao Paulo. FEDERALS PREPARE LINES Home Guard Formed as Troops Leave City--Government Gains in Minas Geraes. NAVY REPORTED WAVERING Revolutionists Tell of Parleys With Officers--Claim Ten Planes Have Deserted to Them. Developments in Brazil. FEDERALS REPORT A VICTORY. Rail Traffic Suspended. Pernambuco Captured. PERNAMBUCO FALLS TO BRAZILIAN REBELS Government Says It Dominates. Rebels Claim Six Planes. The Fall of Pernambuco. Rebels Claim Wide Gains. Capture of Alagoas Claimed. Fliers Reported Arrested. Fighting Reported in Para. Federals Extend Themselves.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Foreign bonds, notably South American issues, broke sharply yesterday on the Stock Exchange, fol  lowing a severe decline the previous day. A long list of issues established few low records for the year, in  some instances reaching bottom prices...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign bonds, notably South American issues, broke sharply yesterday on the Stock Exchange, fol lowing a severe decline the previous day. A long list of issues established few low records for the year, in some instances reaching bottom prices since the bonds were marketed.

headline.main: BONDS DROP HEAVILY LED BY BRAZILIANS; Domestic Issues Decline in Sympathy, Including Best Rails and Utilities. NEW LOW MARKS NUMEROUS All Latin-American Loans Weak-- German Securities Are Off-- French Bonds Strong.

docs.snippet: The Electric Power and Light Corporation is planning to offer to holders of its $7 dividend preferred stock, of which 514,051 shares are outstanding, shares of $6 dividend preferred stock at the rate of about seven of the latter for six, of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Electric Power and Light Corporation is planning to offer to holders of its $7 dividend preferred stock, of which 514,051 shares are outstanding, shares of $6 dividend preferred stock at the rate of about seven of the latter for six, of the former. Many holders of $7 shares have assented to the exchange, it was said yesterday.

headline.main: LISTINGS SOUGHT ON STOCK EXCHANGE; Electric Power & Light Asks Trading in 628,285 More Preferred Shares. MANY LINES REPRESENTED Sao Paulo and Uruguay Would Have Their Bonds Traded on Principal Market.

docs.snippet: The Federal Government claims the recapture of Minas Geraes is imminent, which will be followed by the capitulation of the revolutionists in the south, but reports from rebel headquarters claim continued successes.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Government claims the recapture of Minas Geraes is imminent, which will be followed by the capitulation of the revolutionists in the south, but reports from rebel headquarters claim continued successes.
docs.abstract: Rival armies near meeting; rebels claim advance on Sao Paulo

headline.main: ARMIES NEAR CLASH ON 2 BATTLE FRONTS IN BRAZIL CIVIL WAR; Rebel and Federal Forces About to Meet in Parana and Minas Geraes. CAPITAL CLAIMS VICTORIES Government Sees Revolutionists at Bay With Capitulation Certain Soon. REBELS REPORT SUCCESS Their Communiques Contradict Government, Saying Advance on Sao Paulo Continues. Developments in Brazil. RIVAL ARMIES NEAR MEETING Conditions in South Unchanged. ARMIES NEAR CLASH IN BRAZIL CIVIL WAR Communique Is Reassuring. Federals Retake Cities. Garrisons Still Loyal. Bank Holiday Still Enforced. Rebels Reported Victorious. Battle Impends at Castro. President Upholds Stand. Northern States Occupied.

headline.main: FIND UTILITIES SAFE IN LATIN AMERICA; I.T. & T. and Foreign Power Report Their Properties Operating Normally. BUILDING WORK GOES ON Officials Confident Underlying Conditions Are Sound in Southern Republics. System Covers Vast Area. Linked with Radio Circuits. FIND UTILITIES SAFE IN LATIN AMERICA
